t8DC0tDS3ziCts3fi.name: Longevity
t8DC0tDS3ziCts3fi.notes: You fail aging rolls only on a 17 or 18, or only on an 18 if your modified HT is 17 or better

t94qJyFWJq_IoubUr.name: Luck
t94qJyFWJq_IoubUr.notes: Usable once per hour of play

tt0ntmiIxv1UOxi-_.name: Miserliness
tt0ntmiIxv1UOxi-_.notes: Make a self-control roll any time you are called on to spend money. If the expenditure is large, this roll may be at -5 or worse (GM’s decision). If you fail, you refuse to spend the money.

P0fVzV2d9fAID5lQc.name: Racial Innate Spells
P0fVzV2d9fAID5lQc.notes: Each with maximum Magery 1 and maximum energy cost 3, ignore pre-requisites

nw1OVQ3rt98SeGVPc.text: Leprechauns are tiny, only about a foot high. Determine height normally for their ST before racial modifiers are applied, then double it and read inches for feet. Weight is negligible – 10 to 15 pounds. They have rosy cheeks and bright eyes. Their hair is curly, tending toward black or red, turning to white in older individuals. Their complexions are ruddy. Most males wear bushy side whiskers, and a few wear close-cropped beards. Their builds are portly.

nuJCOn1eEIXi0ITfT.text: Leprechauns are seldom seen without their full ensemble of white shirt and hose, green breeches, vest, coat and hat, and shiny black shoes with a gleaming buckle. Females wear green dresses and bonnets with white petticoats and the same sort of shoes as the males. Most males carry an unhewn, knobby walking-stick.
